gui.controller

Class ParkSettingsScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.controller.ParkSettingsScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class ParkSettingsScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for the Park Settings screen, responsible for managing park settings such as estimated visit time, reserved entries, and maximum capacity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParkSettingsScreenController

        public ParkSettingsScreenController(java.lang.Object park,
                                    java.lang.Object employee)
        Constructs a new instance of ParkSettingsScreenController with the specified park and employee objects.
        Parameters:
        park - The park object whose settings are being managed.
        employee - The employee object responsible for managing the park settings.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initializes the Park Settings screen, populating fields with current park information. This method fetches the latest park data and updates the UI accordingly.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • onChangeEstimatedVisitTimeRequest

        public void onChangeEstimatedVisitTimeRequest()
        Handles the action to request a change in the estimated visit time for the park. This method sends a request to update the estimated visit time and notifies the user of the outcome.

      • onChangeReservedEntriesRequest

        public void onChangeReservedEntriesRequest()
        Handles the action to request a change in the number of reserved entries for the park. This method sends a request to update the reserved entries and notifies the user of the outcome.

      • onChangeCapacityRequest

        public void onChangeCapacityRequest()
        Handles the action to request a change in the maximum capacity for the park. This method sends a request to update the maximum capacity and notifies the user of the outcome.

      • validateGuiFields

        private boolean validateGuiFields(int request)
        Validates specific input fields in the graphical user interface (GUI) based on the provided request type. Each request type corresponds to a specific field that needs validation.
        Parameters:
        request - An integer representing the type of validation request: 1 for validating new capacity field, 2 for validating new reserved entries field, 3 for validating new estimated visit time field.
        Returns:
        true if the input for the specified field passes validation; false otherwise, along with an error message displayed for the invalid field.

      • hideErrorMessage

        private void hideErrorMessage()
        Hides the error message label and error section in the GUI.

      • showErrorMessage

        private void showErrorMessage(java.lang.String error)
        Shows an error message in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        error - The error message to be displayed.
